Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: The Florentine Bed \& Breakfast

The lounge is about eleven feet wide, and twelve feet long; a sturdy oak door in the middle of the north wall is framed by two squeaky clean windows, and an archway at the southeast corner leads to a set of stairs. A refinished fireplace is set in the southern wall. An upholstered black chair, an upholstered brown chair and a cozy couch furnish the room. An overused bulletin board hangs from the east wall behind a cedar counter. An antique brass counter-style bell stands on the south end of the counter.

The lounge is about eleven feet wide, and twelve feet long; a sturdy oak door in the middle of the north wall is framed by two squeaky clean windows, and an archway at the southeast corner leads to a set of stairs. A refinished fireplace is set in the southern wall. An upholstered black chair, an upholstered brown chair and a cozy couch furnish the room. An overused bulletin board hangs from the east wall behind a cedar counter. An antique brass counter-style bell stands on the south end of the counter.

The lounge is about eleven feet wide, and twelve feet long; a sturdy oak door in the middle of the north wall is framed by two squeaky clean windows, and an archway at the southeast corner leads to a set of stairs. A refinished fireplace is set in the southern wall. An upholstered black chair, an upholstered brown chair and a cozy couch furnish the room. An overused bulletin board hangs from the east wall behind a cedar counter. An antique brass counter-style bell stands on the south end of the counter.
a sturdy oak door leading north
A sturdy oak door leads to the north. $(parent-desc)
A sturdy oak door leads to the north. $(parent-desc)
an archway leading southeast
A wide wood passage leading to a staircase. $(parent-desc)
A wide wood passage leading to a staircase. $(parent-desc)
the ceiling

The ceiling of the lounge doesn't seem to be too tall, and has recently been redone in oak with suitable supports. A large animal would be able to walk through comfortably. Sounds from the first floor come through the ceiling periodically.
The ceiling of the small lounge has been redone in oak with suitable supports.
black-upholstered armchair

An armchair, reupholstered in black woven fabric. The oak legs are uncovered and bear no flaws. The arms and back, built as a continuous piece wrapping around the seat, curve outwards and down slightly.
A black upholstered armchair. The upholstery has been recently replaced with a decent woven fabric.
An armchair, reupholstered in black woven fabric. The oak legs are uncovered and bear no flaws.
black armchair's arm
Both arms of this black upholstered armchair curve outwards and down towards the floor.
The black fabric upholstered arms of an armchair.
the back of a black armchair
The curved back of this black armchair is cushioned with woven broadcloth.
The back of the black fabric-upholstered armchair. It is covered in a decent woven fabric.
armchair's oak leg
The legs of this fabric-covered armchair are made from oak and appear to be flawless.
The legs of this fabric-covered armchair are made from oak and appear to be flawless.
black armchair's seat
The seat cushion of this armchair is covered in woven black broadcloth and has been recently replaced.
The armchair's seat cushion is covered in black cloth and has been recently replaced.
reupholstered brown leather armchair

This armchair is covered in pale brown leather that has been recently added; only the oaken legs are bared, and they seem to be flawless. The arms and back, built as a continuous piece wrapping around the seat, curve outwards and down slightly.
A reupholstered brown leather armchair.
An armchair, covered in pale brown leather; only the oaken legs are bared, and they seem to be flawless.
brown armchair's arm
The brown leather arms of an armchair provide a comfortable rest for the uppr limbs.
The brown leather arms of an armchair provide a comfortable rest for the uppr limbs.
the back of a brown armchair
The curved back of this brown armchair has been recently restuffed and reupholstered for a comfy sit.
The back of the brown leather armchair.
armchair's oaken legs
The four oak legs of this brown armchair are round and flawless. They end in brass feet.
The legs of this leather armchair are made from oak and appear to be flawless.
brown armchair's seat
The seat cushion of this armchair is covered in pale brown leather.
The armchair's seat cushion is covered in pale brown leather.
the chimney
The fieldstone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the southern wall to the ceiling. There is no mantel or shelf on the chimney, but it has otherwise been repaired.
The stone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the southern wall.
The stone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the southern wall to the ceiling.
the northeast corner
The northeast corner of the lounge.
The northeast corner of the room.
the northwest corner
The northwest corner of the lounge.
The northwest corner.
the southeast corner
The southeastern corner of the lounge.
The southeast corner.
the southwest corner
The southwestern corner of the small lounge.
The southwest corner.
the cozy couch
The long, low-backed couch is full of new stuffing, making it a relatively comfortable seat or sleep.
the arms of the couch
The arms of the couch have been redone and are ready to act as rests for various body parts.
the back of the couch
The low back of this couch is full of fresh stuffing, ensuring everybody finds a comfortable seat.
couch leg
The four legs of this couch are carved with elaborate fleur-de-lis.
couch's cozy seat
The couch's seat is padded and covered in stuffed leather, secured along the edges with new nails.
long, cedar counter

The cedar countertop. This counter extends five feet in length, two feet in width and stands roughly two and one half feet from the floor. It has been evened out so that people can rest objects or items on it safely. The front is inlaid with decorative panels.
The cedar counter.

The cedar countertop. This counter extends five feet in length, two feet in width and stands roughly two and one half feet from the floor. It has been evened out so that people can rest objects or items on it safely. The front is inlaid with decorative panels.
the dwindling fire

Base:Description.night: A dwindling fire is burning on a few logs within the hearth.
Base:Description.day: A fire is barely burning on a few logs within the hearth.

Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the simple, oak floor

The floor is made from oak planks, of various widths oak. The planks have begun to warp in various places, making the possibility of tripping a real danger. Small insects creep in and out of the lifted wood leisurely.

The floor is made from oak planks, of various widths oak. The planks have begun to warp in various places, making the possibility of tripping a real danger. Small insects creep in and out of the lifted wood leisurely

The floor is made from oak planks, of various widths oak. The planks have begun to warp in various places, making the possibility of tripping a real danger. Small insects creep in and out of the lifted wood leisurely

The floor is made from oak planks, of various widths oak. The planks have begun to warp in various places, making the possibility of tripping a real danger. Small insects creep in and out of the lifted wood leisurely
The floor is made from uneven oak planks, of various widths.
The floor is made from uneven oak planks, of various widths.
overused bulletin board

The bulletin board with posts in the most current news. It shows obvious signs of wear and tear, with papers dangling askew from its surface. $[Popup($actor, this, "html:forumboard");] OOC: The notices are represented by an In Character forum at http://forum.skotos.net/forumdisplay.php?s=\&forumid=94
The bulletin board with posts in the most current news. It shows obvious signs of wear and tear, with papers dangling askew from its surface.
All posts are displayed and easy to EXAMINE.
the warped eastern wall

The eastern wall of the lounge is constructed of pine logs cut, hewn square, and set vertically in a wall trench dug roughly five feet deep. The wood itself has begun to warp, leaving openings for creepy crawlies to get in and out of the room. The poles were hewn to a thickness of eight to twelve inches and once matched so well on the inner line as to give no glimpse of the outer world, but now occasional glimpses of light can seen in the daytime.

The eastern wall of the lounge is constructed of pine logs cut, hewn square, and set vertically in a wall trench dug roughly five feet deep. The wood itself has begun to warp, leaving openings for creepy crawlies to get in and out of the room.
the warped north wall

The northern wall of the lounge is constructed of pine logs cut, hewn square, and set vertically in a wall trench dug roughly five feet deep. The wood itself has begun to warp, leaving openings for creepy crawlies to get in and out of the room. The poles were hewn to a thickness of eight to twelve inches and once matched so well on the inner line as to give no glimpse of the outer world, but now occasional glimpses of light can seen in the daytime. A slightly warped door framed by a filmy window on each side is set carefully in its center.

The northern wall of the lounge is constructed of pine logs cut, hewn square, and set vertically in a wall trench dug roughly five feet deep. The wood itself has begun to warp, leaving openings for creepy crawlies to get in and out of the room. A slightly warped door and two filmy windows are set in it.
the warped south wall

The southern wall of the lounge is constructed of pine logs cut, hewn square, and set vertically in a wall trench dug roughly five feet deep. The wood itself has begun to warp, leaving openings for creepy crawlies to get in and out of the room. The poles were hewn to a thickness of eight to twelve inches and once matched so well on the inner line as to give no glimpse of the outer world, but now occasional glimpses of light can seen in the daytime. It cannily incorporates a crumbling fieldstone fireplace with a cracked chimney.

The southern wall of the lounge is constructed of pine logs cut, hewn square, and set vertically in a wall trench dug roughly five feet deep. The wood itself has begun to warp, leaving openings for creepy crawlies to get in and out of the room. It includes a crumbling fireplace.
the warped western wall

The close-studded, half-timbered western wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high; a grimy sliding door is set in the middle of the wall.

The half-timbered western wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster which have begun to crack. A grimy door is set in the middle of the wall.

The half-timbered western wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster which have begun to crack. A grimy door is set in the middle of the wall.

The half-timbered western wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster which have begun to crack. A grimy door is set in the middle of the wall.
The western side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of uneven wood and crumbling plaster.

The half-timbered western wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster which have begun to crack. A grimy door is set in the middle of the wall.
the glazed casement windows
The glazed casement windows, roughly square, are set to each side of a wooden door in the northern wall. Through the windows:
